cohort: Multiple Myeloma, RRMM, by Provider Regimen Selection (2024–2025)
summary: High variability in provider selection of high-margin regimens. Dr. Thompson uses Dara-based regimens in only 18% of eligible patients vs. practice average of 34%.

clinical_impact.description: Standardizing regimen selection across providers could improve patient outcomes.

metrics.description: Potential PFS improvement with optimized regimen selection
Higher response rates with Dara-based regimens

peer_comparison.description: Top RRMM providers use Dara-based regimens in 55% of eligible patients vs. your practice average of 34%. Dr. Anderson's selection patterns align with top performers.

action_steps.text: Schedule peer-to-peer learning between Dr. Thompson and Dr. Anderson
Create automated decision support tools in EHR
Develop RRMM case review process for non-Dara regimen selections
Create provider-specific reports on regimen selection patterns
Implement educational intervention for Dr. Thompson and Dr. Richardson
Establish monthly case review for regimen optimization

suggestions.text: Share provider-specific financial and clinical outcomes data
Analyze factors driving provider regimen selection decisions
